Pre-Game Insights: Cyprus are on a run of back-to-back victories after winning just one of their previous 13 matches.
Kosovo have lost their last three games on the bounce and have won just one of their last six matches.
The visitors will be looking to shake off their latest results and get their first points on the board next week.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The two teams last faced off in a Nations League clash back in September 2022 which the Dardanelles won 5-1.
Cyprus have managed just two clean sheets in their last 17 games across all competitions.
Kosovo have failed to score any goals in four of their last five matches.
Cyprus were ranked 127th in the latest FIFA rankings and now sit 21 places behind their midweek opponents.
Others: The home side kicked off their Nations League campaign on a winning note and now sit second in Group 2 with three points from an obtainable three.
Ioannis Pittas scored the sole goal of the game late in the first half for Cyprus against Lithuania.
Kosovo were beaten 3-0 by Romania in their tournament opener and could have no real complaints about the result after managing just one shot on target throughout the match.
